arm_group.description: lifestyle counselling using the interactive assessment, counselling and education (I-ACE)-based method.
lifestyle counselling using the standard lifestyle advice (SLA) program currently provided to Clalit Health Services patients.

brief_summary.textblock:
Aim: To evaluate a culturally-adapted method of lifestyle assessment, counseling, and
      education among Arab people with diabetes who have varying literacy skills using an
      interactive computerized tool and graphically-enhanced patient logs for dietary and physical
      activity.

      The investigators hypothesize that this tool will: a) increase patients' knowledge and
      understanding of the role of lifestyle (diet and physical activity) in diabetes management;
      b) improve patients' engagement in monitoring dietary intake and physical activity; c)
      improve dietary and physical activity behaviors and self-blood glucose monitoring (SBGM)
      practices; d) improve glycemic control; and, e) improve the efficiency of lifestyle
      assessment, education and counseling while increasing patients' engagement in the process.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diabetes Lifestyle Assessment and Educational Tools

detailed_description.textblock:
Aim: To evaluate a culturally-adapted method of lifestyle assessment, counseling, and
      education among Arab people with diabetes who have varying literacy skills using an
      interactive computerized tool and graphically-enhanced patient logs for dietary and physical
      activity. The investigators will evaluate the effectiveness of this method for: a)
      increasing patients' knowledge and understanding of the role of lifestyle (diet and physical
      activity) in diabetes management; b) improving patients' engagement in monitoring dietary
      intake and physical activity; c) improving dietary and physical activity behaviors and
      self-blood glucose monitoring (SBGM) practices; d) improving glycaemic control; and, e)
      improving the efficiency of lifestyle assessment, education and counseling while increasing
      patients' engagement in the process.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  40-64 years old

          -  Diabetes duration≤10 years

          -  BMI 27-40 kg/m2

          -  Diagnosis of type 2 diabetes mellitus in medical record

          -  HbA1c 8.0%-11.0%

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Insulin treatment

          -  Inadequate control of co-morbid conditions

          -  Factors that may limit adherence to interventions (e.g., any medical or physical
             condition that limits the ability to participate in physical activity or standard
             diets recommended for people with diabetes, pregnancy, uncontrolled psychiatric
             condition, significant cognitive impairment, blindness).

intervention.description: lifestyle counselling using the interactive assessment, counselling and education (I-ACE)-based method.
lifestyle counselling using the standard lifestyle advice (SLA) program currently provided to Clalit Health Services patients.

clinical_study.official_title: Development and Evaluation of Lifestyle Assessment and Educational Tools for Diabetic People With Limited Literacy

other_outcome.description: Medical regimen for diabetes management, i.e. self-reported medical treatment for diabetes.

overall_official.affiliation: Sheba Medical Center, the Gertner Institute for Epidemiology & Health Policy Research
Gertner Institute for Epidemiology & Health Policy Research

primary_outcome.description: Change in diabetes-related lifestyle (diet and physical activity) knowledge, will be assessed with a diet knowledge questionnaire specially adapted for this population. Change in physical activity knowledge will be measured with the SKILLD diabetes knowledge questionnaire.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of the Unit of Cardiovascular Epidemiology, The Gertner Institute for Epidemiology & Health Policy Research.

secondary_outcome.description: Patient engagement in monitoring diet intake and physical activity, assessed with 3-day dietary and physical activity records.
Dietary and physical activity behaviours, assessed with food frequency and physical activity questionnaires.
Self Blood Glucose Monitoring practices. Information will be downloaded from the blood glucose meters' memory.
Glycaemic control, assessed with HbA1c levels.
Change of weight and waist circumference during follow-up.

collaborator.agency: The Gertner Institute for Epidemiology & Health Policy Research
European Foundation for the Study of Diabetes

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
